unnormalised: **Telecom Sector Braces for Data Plan Price Revisions Amidst 5G Rollout**
normalised: telecom sector braces for data plan price revisions amidst five G rollout

unnormalised: New Delhi, October 26, 2023 – India's telecommunications sector is anticipating potential revisions in data plan pricing structures as operators ramp up their 5G infrastructure deployment. Increased capital expenditure and operational costs associated with 5G are expected to put upward pressure on consumer tariffs.

unnormalised: Analysts at IIM Ahmedabad predict a phased implementation of price adjustments, starting with premium plans before impacting the more budget-friendly options currently popular in Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities. Industry experts are drawing parallels with the "Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year" approach, advocating for innovative bundling and value-added services to mitigate the impact on price-sensitive customers.

unnormalised: Bharti Airtel and Reliance Jio are reportedly exploring various strategies to optimize resource allocation and improve network efficiency. These include dynamic spectrum sharing and infrastructure sharing agreements. The current average data consumption per user stands at 18 GB per month, a figure expected to rise dramatically with wider 5G adoption. Some reports suggest potential price hikes of up to Rs. 50-75 per month for existing plans over the next six months.
